Interface DeviceWithCLI

All Known Implementing Classes:
Layer3Switch, Router
public interface DeviceWithCLI
An interface representing a device that has a Command Line Interface (CLI). This interface provides methods for interacting with the device's CLI, configuring IP helper addresses, and retrieving the device's name.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Izzy Kavanagh

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    configureIpHelper(int vlanInterface, String helperAddress)
    Configures an IP helper address for a specific VLAN interface.
    String
    getName()
    Gets the name of the device.
    void
    startCLI()
    Starts the Command Line Interface (CLI) of the device.

  • Method Details

    • startCLI

      void startCLI()
      Starts the Command Line Interface (CLI) of the device. This method should initiate the device's CLI for user interaction.

    • configureIpHelper

      void configureIpHelper(int vlanInterface, String helperAddress)
      Configures an IP helper address for a specific VLAN interface. The helper address is typically used to relay certain types of traffic (such as DHCP) to a specific address.
      Parameters:
      vlanInterface - - VLAN interface number to configure.
      helperAddress - - IP address of the helper address to set.

    • getName

      String getName()
      Gets the name of the device. This method returns a string representing the device's name, which is typically used for identification in a network.
      Returns:
      The name of the device.
